Posts.Content: I have just read you 'blog' (I think you call it !!), and I was so impressed with your attitude, and I do hope I can be of the same mind.  I was diagnosed with breast cancer in June and had a lumpectomy on 7th Sept.  with removal of 2 lymph nodes.  Fortunately I had clear margins and the lymph nodes were clear, but I have to have 3 weeks of radiotherapy which I am not looking forward to.   But I must thank my lucky stars that it is not chemo.   I am concerned that most of the blogs I read people are put on 5 years of Tamoxifen, I have been told that I will be on Anastrazole, is this one and the same ?. I have taken on board your advice and that it is do-able, at present I am a nervous wreck at times, but must learn to relax. Thank you again xxx
Posts.Title: Finished Rads now Tamoxifen!!!

Posts.Content: Hello Lyn I noticed you are are just starting out too.  I am just about to have my radiotherapy for 3 weeks so I am a little nervous, and not happy about taking meds for 5 years afterwards as I am a bit of a health nut and not used to taking medication, only vitimins.   However we must go along with the medical team. I do hope all goes well with you. Mo
Posts.Title: Finished Rads now Tamoxifen!!!

Posts.Content: I am in exactly the same position as you Londongurl, as I was diagnosed as DCIS, and had a lumpectomy on 7th Sept, and  they also removed a couple of lymph nodes.  A long 10 day wait to find the margins were clear as were the lymph nodes.  I am now awaiting my radiotherapy starting in a couple of weeks, and have been told I will have to have 5 years on Anastrozole, which I am not looking forward to, and am now wondering if this is necessary, they have really thrown us in a loop.  Damned if we do and damned if we don't'.    I wish I hadn;t got a choice !!! Anyway take care
Posts.Title: BBC Report

Posts.Content: Hi Katie, Also wishing you the best outcome, and just remember  worry gets you nowhere at all. !! God bless and hope you will be giving us good news next week. Stay positive. Mo
Posts.Title: New to site and advised to join this group

Posts.Content: I also had a lumpectomy in early Sept, and am still blue around the nipple, but it is fading by the day, my husband says I resemble a well know English garden bird !!  Have been told by my doctor that it will fade.   Good luck to you with your treatment,  I shall be starting my radiotherapy in the next few weeks, but having heard all this recent news on breast operations not being necessary I am having second thoughts and will check it out first with my doctor. Regards Mo
